qas.question: What is a brewery called that makes a small amount of beer?
In general, how much beer can a microbrewery make and still be classified as a microbrewery?
What would you call a microbrewery that also has a restaurant or a pub?
What city is home to the oldest known brewery in the world that is still active?
What year was The Benedictine Weihenstephan Brewery first licensed as a brewery?
How often can a microbrewery produce 396 thousand US gallons?

plausible_answers.text: The highest density of breweries in the world

qas.question: What exists in the Franconia Region of German?
How many breweries does the Upper German Region have?
What can trace its roots to the year 786?

context: A <a0_0>microbrewery<a0_0/>, or craft brewery, produces a limited amount of beer. The maximum amount of beer a brewery can produce and still be classed as a microbrewery varies by region and by authority, though is usually <a1_0>around 15,000 barrels<a1_0/> (1.8 megalitres, 396 thousand imperial gallons or 475 thousand US gallons) <b5_0>a year<b5_0/>. A <a2_0>brewpub<a2_0/> is a type of microbrewery that incorporates a pub or other eating establishment. <b6_0>The highest density of breweries in the world<b6_0/>, most of them microbreweries, exists in the German Region of Franconia, especially in the district of Upper Franconia, which has <b7_0>about 200<b7_0/> breweries. <b8_0><b9_0>The Benedictine Weihenstephan Brewery<b9_0/><b8_0/> in Bavaria, Germany, can trace its roots to the year 768, as a document from that year refers to a hop garden in the area paying a tithe to the monastery. The brewery was licensed by the City of <a3_0>Freising<a3_0/> in <a4_0>1040<a4_0/>, and therefore is the oldest working brewery in the world.
